title: Little Simz, EartH, review: a victorious night for a rapper too long overlooked
text:
Half an hour into Little Simz’s show at EartH in Hackney on Tuesday night, the 25-year-old north-London rapper and actor stopped grinning for a moment to scold an imaginary adversary. “You know there are those people who have so much to say, about stuff they know nothing about,” said Simz - born Simbi Ajikawo - her all-white ensemble glowing beneath the strobe light.

“I don’t get that. They say, 'Oh, she’s meant to be independent but she had this person backing her...' But I worked f***ing hard. And I just want to remind people real quick…” Simz paused, resuming her customary expression of good-humoured irreverence as the beat dropped, “that I’ve been hot since '06”.

Fans who recognised the...
description: Half an hour into Little Simz’s show at EartH in Hackney on Tuesday night, the 25-year-old north-London rapper and actor stopped grinning for a moment to scold an imaginary adversary.
